Audio Description:
Veterans: Jobs in the Federal Government are Open to You
Beneath an eagle insignia is the word “Veterans” in large, black capital letters. In smaller print is the text of the poster: “Jobs in the Federal Government Are Open to You. You get preference in appointment. For full information, see the Civil Service Secretary at any first- or second-class post office, or write to the U.S. Civil Service Commission, Washington 25, D.C. If you are a former employee of the Federal Government, you may be entitled to reemployment. Ask About it.”  The text is on the right side of the poster. Along the left side of the poster are six black and white drawings of the faces of three service men and three service women on an orange background. The military personnel represent the branches of the armed services. Contrasting with the orange tinted hats of Army and Air Force personnel in the poster are the hats worn by the Navy seaman and WAV in the poster, which are white.
Creator: United States. Civil Service Commission
Description: Poster, 51 x 36 cm, artist: Victor Beals
